ai_reply.text:
@dwlz Reframing

A lot of what engineers built wasn’t easy, it was just standardized. Now AI is compressing that layer.

So it’s less about “work harder” and more about:

Work on deeper problems.
Own outcomes, not just tasks.
Build leverage.

The bar is rising, that’s the opportunity.

original_post.text:
I think the inconvenient truth that a lot of software engineers are coming to realize right now is that what they've been working on is just not all that hard.

The solution is to start working on harder things.

ai_reply.text: @Zai_org 700+ tool calls in a single session is the real benchmark here. every other model tops out around 50 before context degrades. curious what the failure mode looks like at call 400 though, does it gracefully degrade or just start hallucinating tool schemas?

original_post.text:
Introducing GLM-5: From Vibe Coding to Agentic Engineering

GLM-5 is built for complex systems engineering and long-horizon agentic tasks. Compared to GLM-4.5, it scales from 355B params (32B active) to 744B (40B active), with pre-training data growing from 23T to 28.5T tokens. https://t.co/uGYQUjIbbs

ai_reply.display_name: Jay ( Building Radarkit Ai Seo tool )
ai_reply.text: @fba everyone wants results but nobody wants to do the unsexy work that gets them

original_post.text:
Everyone wants to rank on Google.

Nobody wants to fix their meta titles, clean up their internal links, or move their blog from a subdomain to a subfolder.

The boring work is the work that moves the needle.

ai_reply.text:
@ccccjjjjeeee The real flex isn't the port — it's "very little steering." That's the gap closing between "AI writes code" and "AI understands architecture."

Legacy migration just went from a 6-month budget line item to a weekend project.

original_post.text:
It actually worked!

For the past couple of days I’ve been throwing 5.3-codex at the C codebase for SimCity (1989) to port it to TypeScript. 

Not reading any code, very little steering. 

Today I have SimCity running in the browser. 

I can’t believe this new world we live in. https://t.co/Pna2ilIjdh

ai_reply.text: @ccccjjjjeeee @AmpCode When you're deep in a 6-hour session, pleasant matters more than fast. Claude keeps architecture coherent across files. Codex doesn't.

ai_reply.text:
@rameerez WebMCP in Chrome 146 is a game-changer. AI agents querying and executing services directly without browsing like a human removes the biggest bottleneck in web automation.

Declarative service discovery via navigator.modelContext means any website can become an API for agents.

original_post.text:
Chrome is working on WebMCP

OpenClaw's biggest problem (and any AI agent's) when using a browser is that it's TOO slow and dumb

Opens a tab, waits 3s, then navigates to the page, waits 5s, then takes a screenshot, waits 2s, then scrolls, waits...

WebMCP solves this
